channel.title: Help! How to start client on linux ubuntu?
channel.description: Hey, i've got a problem with starting client on ubuntu. The client i downloaded, is a .bat file, so i dunno how to run this on ubuntu. How to create file, or how to run this .bat file, to start client properly? Please help, i'm amateur in these things...

item.title: Help! How to start client on linux ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @CreatorAlex CreatorAlex
item.description:
@CreatorAlex wrote:

You won’t be able to use a file to run the client.

Open the folder with all of the client files, right click in the empty space and click “Open terminal here”.

Now open your batch file using a text editor. Copy the command “java *” and past it into the terminal. By pressing enter, your client should run.

I should warn you, all filenames will either have to be lowercase or match the case that they are read as, unlike Windows.

Read full topic
item.source: Help! How to start client on linux ubuntu?

item.title: Help! How to start client on linux ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @Kegels Kegels
item.description:
@Kegels wrote:

there is no way to run batch files in ubuntu, though there is a small possibility you may be able to run it through wine, its a free program for ubuntu that lets you run windows programs. although i have come across a server call “zombiescape” and he made a client that ran ubuntu .sh files, you could check that out. goodluck

Read full topic
item.source: Help! How to start client on linux ubuntu?

item.title: Help! How to start client on linux ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @Top_Glitch Top Glitch
item.description:
@Top_Glitch wrote:

Hey, do you have any other disk? I.e - Windows?

If so you can download something that allows you to use both OS’S.

If not, let me know and I’ll find a tutorial for you.
